file_content.text: We told the Cathar to stay away from Taris. Maybe now they'll listen.
Your serum worked well. The Cathar were crippled.
Good, good. No doubt word of their champions' cowardice has reached the Cathar by now.
Those felines are nothing without their pride. You've dealt them a heavy blow today. Well done.
The Cathar will soon know fear.
All these colonists... it's sickening, my lord.
These Republic settlers just won't stop coming here.
I'm Doctor Korvus, with Alien Control. I'm here to solve the Cathar problem.
The Cathar are an annoyance, nothing more.
They're only pests.
For now. My data suggests they'll become progressively unmanageable if left unchecked.
Go on, doctor
Of course, my lord.
Fifty credits says my blaster gets the job done faster than whatever you've got cooked up.
Get in line.
Save your money. Your blaster may play a vital part in what I'm "cooking up."
Give me details.
Your expertise is most welcome, agent.
What is it you do, doctor...?
"Alien Control"?
Korvus. I analyze hostile species. Then I break them.
Good for you.
The Cathar's strength lies in their spirit. Nine times out of ten, they'll fight to their dying breath.
So I've developed a serum that dampens the Cathar's inherent aggression. Less fight, more flight.
You're saying this serum will turn the Cathar into a bunch of cowards?
It'll make them scared?
Essentially, yes.
Could this serum be used on other species?
So it only works on Cathar?
Sadly, no. Even the Bothans, for all their biological similarities, only develop a small rash when exposed to the formula.
That's a terrible idea.
I know a dozen shaved Wookiees who can attest to my effectiveness. I get results.
As of twenty-six minutes ago, my serum is approved and ready for a trial demonstration.
The sight of their strongest warriors reduced to mewling runts ought to demoralize the Cathar nicely. Care to do the honors?
What's involved?
Sounds easy.
Yes, it'll hardly be a fair fight once you administer that serum.
I've prepared several special darts. The serum will kick in moments after it enters the Cathar's bloodstream.
After that, I'd recommend waiting until they're good and pathetic before you finish them off. For effect.
Not really. [Refuse quest]
You're mistaken if you think the Cathar will just roll over.
So many Cathar. What to do, what to do....
